tit.e: Kujigata-osadamegaki (the law of the Edo bakufu)

sen.j: 公事方御定書（くじかたおさだめがき、くじがたおさだめがき）は、江戸幕府の基本法典。
sen.e: Kujigata-osadamegaki were the fundamental codes in the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
Kujigata-osadamegaki were the fundamental codes in the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
Kujigata-osadamegaki were the fundamental codes in the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 享保改革を推進した8代征夷大将軍・徳川吉宗の下で作成され、1742年（寛保2年）に仮完成した。
sen.e: Kujigata-osadamegaki was developed under the eighth Yoshimune TOKUGAWA regime who promoted Kyoho reforms and was completed provisionally in 1742.

Kujigata-osadamegaki was developed and completed provisionally in 1742 under the eighth Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") Yoshimune TOKUGAWA, who promoted Kyoho reforms.
sen.cmt: ・訳漏れです。（征夷大将軍）・TOKUGAWAに続く関係代名詞節は限定用法ではないので、コンマを加えました。・年代から判断して、「下で」は「仮完成した」にも係るため修正しました。
sen.e: Kujigata-osadamegaki was developed and completed provisionally in 1742 under the eighth Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") Yoshimune TOKUGAWA, who promoted Kyoho reforms.

sen.j: 上巻・下巻の2巻からなり、上巻は基本法令を、下巻は旧来の判例に基づいた刑事法令を収録した。
sen.e: There were vol.1 and vol.2 and vol.1 recorded the fundamental law and vol.2 recorded the criminal law.
It consisted of vol. 1 and vol. 2 and vol.1 recorded the fundamental law and vol. 2 recorded the criminal law.
sen.cmt: ・There wereだと何を指すのかが曖昧なので、It consisted ofとしました。・vol.と数字の間にはスペースが必要です。
sen.e: It consisted of vol. 1 and vol. 2 and vol.1 recorded the fundamental law and vol. 2 recorded the criminal law.

sen.j: 特に下巻は御定書百箇条（おさだめがきひゃっかじょう）と呼ばれている。
sen.e: Vol.2 is especially called "Osadamegaki Hyakkajo" (御定書百箇条) (law code).
Vol. 2 is especially called "Osadamegaki Hyakkajo" (law code).
sen.cmt: ・vol.と数字の間にはスペースが必要です。・漢字の問題ではないので、原文は削除しました。・御定書百箇条→Osadamegaki Hyakkajo [定訳不明です]

sen.j: 編纂は老中の松平乗邑を主任に、勘定奉行、寺社奉行、江戸町奉行の石河政朝の三奉行が中心となる。
sen.e: Roju (senior councilor), Norisato Matsudaira was the chief editor and three magistrates from kanjo bugyo (commissioner of finance), jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines) and Masatomo ISHIKO from Edo machi-bugyo (Edo town magistrate's office) played a central role.

sen.cmt: ・老中はこの人物だけではないため、コンマは省きました。・指示に従って「松平」は大文字表記としました。

sen.j: 上巻は元文3年（1738年）に完成するが以降も追加作業が行われ、寺社奉行時代の大岡忠相（越前守）らが関わった。
sen.e: Although vol.1 was completed in 1738, additional work was needed and Tadasuke OOKA, Echizen no kuni no kami (Governor of Echizen Province) and others were involved.

sen.j: 延享2年（1745年）に将軍吉宗が隠居すると打ち切られる。
sen.e: After Yoshimune retired in 1745, the project was terminated.

sen.e: Bakufu's law, especially for crimes and trials

sen.j: 原則は三奉行と京都所司代、大坂城代のみが閲覧を許される秘法（罰則あり）である。
sen.e: This was a secret art (penalty) allowed only for san bugyo (three magistrates), Kyoto shoshidai (The Kyoto deputy) and Osaka jodai (the keeper of Osaka Castle).

sen.j: しかし評定所では奉行の下で天保12年（1841年）に『棠蔭秘鑑』という写本が作られ、裁判審理の場で利用されていた。
sen.e: However, a manuscript called "Toin shikan" was produced in Hyojosho (conference chamber) managed by Bugyo (magistrate) in 1841, this was utilized at court trials.
However, a manuscript called "Toin shikan" was produced in Hyojosho (conference chamber) managed by Bugyo (magistrate) in 1841, and this was utilized at court trials.
sen.cmt: ・this was utilizedは接続詞が必要です。
sen.e: However, a manuscript called "Toin shikan" was produced in Hyojosho (conference chamber) managed by Bugyo (magistrate) in 1841, and this was utilized at court trials.

sen.j: また極秘裏に諸藩でも写本が流布し、その内容を把握して自藩の法令制定の参照とした。
sen.e: In addition, "Toin shikan" was distributed to various domain secretaries, and personnel in domains captured the contents and referred to it when they established laws in own domain.
In addition, "Toin shikan" was distributed to various domain secretaries, and personnel in the domains captured the contents and referred to it when they established laws in their own domain.
sen.cmt: ・personnel in domainsのdomainsは前述のものなので、定冠詞を加えました。・own domainはtheirが必要です。
sen.e: In addition, "Toin shikan" was distributed to various domain secretaries, and personnel in the domains captured the contents and referred to it when they established laws in their own domain.

sen.j: その為、本来幕府領内でのみ効力を有する法であるが、ある種、日本国内統一法のようなものでもあった。
sen.e: The book itself was applied only in Bakufu, but it was a kind of Japanese uniform law applied across the nation in a certain way.

sen.j: だが、次第に「祖法」化してしまい、田畑永代売買禁止令のように御定書制定の翌年には実質上廃止された法令が、御定書に載せられているがために有効な法律とされて明治4年（1871年）まで存続するなどの弊害もあった。
sen.e: But it was becoming progenitor law and produced negative effects like denpataietaibaibaikinshirei (a ban on buying and selling fields [of rice and other crops]) which was abolished the following year of enacted substantially, remained in force until 1871 since it was described in Goteisho.

But it gradually became progenitor law and produced negative effects like denpataietaibaibaikinshirei (a ban on buying and selling fields [of rice and other crops]), which was abolished in effect the year after the enactment of Kujigata-osadamegaki but remained in force until 1871 since it was described in Kujigata-osadamegaki.
sen.cmt: ・was becomingはここでは不自然なので、gradually becameとしました。・Goteishoは「おさだめがき」なので、正式名称に変えました。・the following year以降が不完全だったため修正しました。・which was abolishedは非制限的に係るため直前にコンマを挿入しました。
